post.body: I use bzr and it's been much more dependable than Time Machine. Having tags and diff is just too critical.
Great job cleaning up the audio and the last roundtable. If you hadn't said anything, I'd never have known there was a problem.
Silly Scotty: Downloads don't equal sales. But if I were to have the cash for a dodgy thing, yours would be my first choice!
Paying friends to use it doesn't count either. ;)
Too late for that. I just made it a favorite. :)
What? You don't count when it's just your mom and brother! :P
*your* path. Nevermind. Have another chardonnay. :)

AAAAHHHH!!! A quiz on your Core Data book?!? But I'm not ready yet! I've been coding, the dog ate my homeworkâ€¦ :)
(nice job BTW)
We'll if you path is anything like mine, day 2 is a bunch of support and reviewing what needs to be patched quickly. :)
Thanks. I'd love to have my 1.0 popularity back though. It was #4 on the *overall* list http://tinyurl.com/6kq72z
Funny. :P Actually, both MoneyWell & Debt Quencher appeared as staff picks the first time on Apple downloads before freebies. :)
Yes, and I make all my tortillas by BOILING THE CRAP out of them.
@nikf Congrats to the whole team on the LittleSnapper/QuickSnapper release & thanks for letting so many of us share the experience!
No worries. If the release goes badly, we'll only blame you until the first patch. :P
Not bad for a feeble, old mind, eh? Now where did I put those Depends.
Don't you have that backwards?
I hope it's a nice stalker. :)
Nothing serious I hope.
Hah! I didn't even get it right. FAIL.
Did you mean _chile_ dogs or were they actually cold. ;)
I save the broadcast viewing for _A Christmas Story_. ;)
I have the DVD and must watch it at least once before Christmas. "Merry Christmas you old savings and loan!"
That would be great but I just want speed and no crashes at this point.
You know I'd send one to you if there was any chance it would be non-toxic by the time it got through customs. :)
A sunny 74 here. :P
Yes, yes. My Twitter head-SHOT is a bit older picture. I am more gray now. :P
Don't make me cry. No I don't. My old TiPB is broke and I haven't invested in a new one yet. So sad. It's an iPhone/paper day.
Excellent news! Thanks.
I'm probably good for some "indie dev" stuff but there are better Cocoa devs around for sure. :)
Chicken. :P

ME TOO!!!
Except replace "one more" with "every" and "Tomorrow" with "Some day real soon"
Impressive! I could use to lose a few kg's myself. ;)
A real photo?!?! :)
I've thought of obtaining a muzzle for myself occasionally (the duct tape hurts to pull off).
How very cool! NOW GET TO WORK! :)
And yet you look so young. :)
Excellent plan! You Realmac fellows are so wise. :)
I see, you're going to get us all hooked on QuickSnapper and then go all "Twitter" on us. :P
But I thought those were *STRAWBERRY* centers!?!? Oh dear.
Except when it screws up during an auto-complete and you don't realize that happened. "What? 12 errors?" ;)
Great Tips! I guess @nikf knows so much about LS because he wrote the whole thing from scratch, eh? ;)
That would make it hard for me to invest in any high-end HDTV.
She's beautiful! Must take after your wife. ;)
LA LA LA LA LA LA - I CAN'T HEAR YOU - LA LA LA LA LA :P
I refuse to give you that one. :P :P :P
w00t! Congrats on new subclass!!! You be nice to your wife now. No sneaking off to write Cocoa stuff. :)
I hope you play piano better than you type. :P
Send them to support@nothirst.com please. The forum is best for discussions. Thanks.
No! I was commenting on the link you posted showed a web page with a missing picture on my iPhone. You're fine. Carry on. :P
If someone wants to sell software to Mac customers, I think their websites should work well on an iPhone.
Hah! Funny. I did have to fix a couple of things though so the final release will be 216. :)
Too bad you don't have an editor in-house that can slash and hack it for you.
I'm so glad I do version control now. I just pulled a thread and I think the sweater is unraveling. Walking an XML tree should be easier.
I'm sorry to have to brag but my customers are better than yours. They just are. It's a fact. :)
I really enjoy running my own one-man shop but do miss the fellowship had at shops like Realmac http://bit.ly/q9U1
When it's okay to be #2: http://tinyurl.com/5jrn7u
Having grown up in a traditional Irish-American household, it's amazing how many of my meals today include a tortilla.
Watching _It's a Wonderful Life_.
Tree is up, (most) lights are working, and the manger scene is up outside. That's probably good enough for now.
I need to get our lawn decorations up and our tree and lights put together then I can hand off the rest to the wife.
So far the only Christmas decorating I've done is the sign for our subdivision (we've done it for years and I have it down to 10 min. work).
Home after cheer and dinner. Feels good to chill in front of the TV.
All done except for the awards. I'm whipped and all cheered out.
Only about 3.5 hours of cheer left. At least Meaghan is up next.
Judy and I are going to see A Christmas Carol at the Alley Theatre tonight http://tinyurl.com/9hens5 (I love the theatre!)
Down a pint of blood but up a few strawberry filled cookies. OM NOM NOM NOM
Heading up to give blood.
Scary that I'm awake to see my last tweet _4 hours ago!_
Almost home. Yea!
Very nice evening with my wife but we're tired. Waiting on my daughter and her friend to exit the concert at the Toyota Center.
That was an incredibly draining debug session after a very long couple days of coding. I need to be done with this now.
Ripping the "sticking paper" off my fingers.
Installing Things update. Hoping it has that "finish tasks with magic" feature I've been waiting for.
First time in about 20 years that I had to pay traffic citations and I'd like to avoid having to do it ever again. Whatta pain.
All accusations by @macdevnet of me having any sort of "toy" are completely false and I'll out him about his jiggly bits if he tweets it. :P
Taking my wife's 3 AM Adoration hour. Strangely, I'm pretty wide awake for this hour of the morning.

I SMELL A WUMPUS!
Er, no. I mean I'm wumped.
MoneyWell 1.4.2 (215) RC4 posted. This should be the final build for this patch unless I stepped in something nasty.
"All code and no play makes Kevin a dull boy." But since I wasn't that exciting to begin with, I'll code some more.
Finished a couple of bios that have been on my (long) list of to do's.
